name: Introductory Geology
description: This course introduces students to the principles of geology. Students will learn about the nature of the Earth and its materials, the structure of the Earth, the processes that shape the Earth's surface and interior, and the history of the Earth and its life.

name: Physical Geology
description: This course focuses on the materials and processes of the solid Earth, including the composition and structure of the Earth, plate tectonics, volcanism, earthquakes, rock and mineral identification, and the interpretation of geologic maps.

name: Historical Geology
description: This course focuses on the history of the Earth and its life, including the principles of stratigraphy and relative dating, radiometric dating, the evolution of life, and the interactions between life and the Earth system.

name: Mineralogy and Petrology
description: This course focuses on the nature and origin of minerals and rocks, including mineral identification, crystallography, the classification of rocks, and the interpretation of rock textures and structures.

name: Sedimentology and Stratigraphy
description: This course focuses on the processes that form sedimentary rocks, including weathering, erosion, transport, deposition, and diagenesis, and the principles of stratigraphy and sedimentary basin analysis.

name: Structural Geology
description: This course focuses on the deformation of rocks and the structures that result, including faults, folds, and fabrics, and the tectonic processes that drive deformation.

name: Geophysics
description: This course focuses on the use of geophysical methods to study the Earth's interior and its processes, including seismic methods, gravity methods, magnetic methods, and electromagnetic methods.

name: Geomorphology
description: This course focuses on the processes that shape the Earth's surface, including weathering, erosion, transport, and deposition, and the landforms and landscapes that result.

name: Environmental Geology
description: This course focuses on the interactions between human societies and the Earth system, including natural hazards, resource use, and environmental management.
